intro: Smilax microdontus, commonly known as the small-toothed catbrier, is a woody vine native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its thorny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spadices, typical of the arum family. Its berries are red when mature and contain several seeds. Smilax microdontus is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and swamps.
